sentences.en: And all the while, you proclaim the church is ignorant.
sentences.cn: 一直以来, 你们都宣称宗教无知.

sentences.en: At such a moment you can proclaim that the capital deserves the esteem of all France.
sentences.cn: 在这时刻,你们可以公开宣告,我们的首都值得全法兰西敬重.

sentences.en: He half - determined that he would proclaim himself.
sentences.cn: 他正要打定主意,想宣布自己的身份.

sentences.en: He that boast of his own knowledge proclaim ignorance.
He was impelled to proclaim his doctrine.
sentences.cn: 他不得不宣扬他的教义.

sentences.en: His classic boyish looks seemed to proclaim his good humour and openness.
sentences.cn: 他的长相非常孩子气,显得性情很好且诚实坦率.

sentences.en: I was officially hooked, and began to publicly proclaim my support.
sentences.cn: 我真真正正的喜欢上了它, 而且正式对外宣布了我的拥护.

sentences.en: I will proclaim it and I will sell it.
sentences.cn: 我不但要宣扬它,还要推销它.

sentences.en: It is always easier to discover and proclaim general principles than to apply them.
sentences.cn: 发现和提出某些普遍原则总比运用这些原则容易.

sentences.en: Pray that I may proclaim it clearly, as I should.
sentences.cn: 叫我按着所该说的话, 将这奥秘发明出来.

sentences.en: Shall I send the Angelic hosts to proclaim this or that?
sentences.cn: 我应该派遣天使们去宣布这个或那个?

sentences.en: The apostles then began to proclaim their experience of Jesus Christ.
sentences.cn: 使徒们从此开始宣告他们关于耶稣基督的经历.

sentences.en: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
True friendship foresees the needs of other rather proclaim its own.
sentences.cn: 真正的伙伴总是考虑别人的需要而不是提出自己的要求.

sentences.en: V. We must proclaim the excellencies of Christ via our Godly living.
sentences.cn: 基督徒必须透过敬虔的行为(生活)来彰显基督的卓越.

trans.tran_cn: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
trans.tran_en: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

trans.tran_cn: 宣告，公布，表明，赞扬，称颂
trans.tran_en: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists
